result.execSummary:
The defendant Darriana C Briggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 8 days time served.
condition of probation/ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1.5 years initial confinement in this case.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $825.00 to be paid to Jacolby H, joint and several with Lewis Houston 15CF1019 and T.H. 15JV278.

Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, if applicable, any balance as a condition of probation/ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain High School Diploma or GED.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Jacolby H and co-defendants Lewis Houston and T.H.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: FORTHWITH.  The first 4 months, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The last 4 months, Huber privileges for work, school, treatment and the defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darriana C Briggs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Darriana C Briggs in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2.5 years with credit for 8 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2.5 years.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*As a condition of probation, the Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  The first 4 months, huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The last 4 months, huber privileges for work, school, treatment and the defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Jacolby H and co-defendants Lewis Houston and T.H.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain High School Diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $825.00 to be paid to Jacolby H, joint and several with Lewis Houston 15CF1019 and T.H. 15JV278.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, if applicable, any balance as a condition of probation/ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1.5 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS  TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed, Theft from person or corpse - PTAC, as a party to a crime, contrary to sec 943.20 (1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), 939.05, a Class G Felony.

Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Final pretrial conference.  Court in trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed with court.

Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  James C. Griffin appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Randy Sitzberger for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nancy Nelson-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/13/15.
css
JusticePoint monitoring to resume upon release.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Darriana C Briggs not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bench warrant served; defendant in custody.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  James Griffin for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/19/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Anastasia J.; Latasia J.; Terry H.; Jacolby H. and Co-Defendant Lewis Houston

Defendant Darriana C Briggs in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Darriana C Briggs in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
